nodes.text: Remove 20 mL a new bottle of Advanced MEM (AMEM) basal medium and discard
Add 10 mL of fetal bovine serum (FBS).
Add 10 mL of GlutaMAX
Add 1 mL of 100X penicillin/streptomycin
Mix thoroughly and label with the date and additives.
IMR90 cells should be grown on dishes/plates/inserts that have been coated with 50 mg/mL bovine collagen I solution
Thawing Cryopreserved Cells
Warm growth medium to 37 °C and prepare materials prior to obtaining a vial of cells from cryostorage.
Remove vial from liquid nitrogen and thaw in 37 °C water bath (1-2 min)
Add 24 mL of growth medium to a 50 mL conical tube .
Transfer the thawed cells from the cryovial into the growth medium using a P1000 pipette and gently mix by inverting 10 times.
Centrifugation at 1,000 x g for 4 minutes at room temperature with a swinging bucket rotor.
Carefully aspirate the supernatant.
Gently resuspend the cells in 12 mL of pre-warmed growth medium, add 13 mL of additional growth medium, and transfer into a collagen-coated 15 cm dish.
Distribute cell suspension on the dish through a combination of gentle rocking and swirling of the dish for approximately 15s
Place in a tissue culture incubator overnight
Check cells the following day for attachment to the dish. Aspirate and replace medium.
Cells should be split three days after being plated at either 4.0 x 104 cells/mL
Pre-warm growth medium and DPBS in a 37 °C water bath and a trypsin aliquot at room temperature for approximately 30 minutes.
Aspirate the growth medium from plates to be passaged.
Rinse cells with pre-warmed DPBS and swirl gently for approximately fi ve seconds
Aspirate the DPBS wash
Add trypsin and rotate gently to distribute evenly across the plate.
Place in tissue culture incubator for 4 minutes, making sure not to stack dishes on top of each other.

Following incubation, use the palm of your hand to gently tap the side of the dish to facilitate detachment. If cells are still attached, incubate for another 2 minutes. Incubate and tap dish until >95% of the cells are detached. Check detachment with microscope.
Add 12 mL growth medium, gently wash the surface of the dish with a pipette, and triturate once to break up any large cell clumps.
Transfer the cell suspension to a 50 mL conical tube.
Wash the dish with an additional 12 mL of growth medium, collect, triturate, and add to the cell suspension
Pellet cells at 1,000 x g for 4 minutes at room temperature in centrifuge with a swinging bucket rotor.
Aspirate the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet in 12 mL of growth medium.
Triturate at least four times to thoroughly break up the majority of clumped cells. Add additional growth medium to dilute the cell suspension if desired.
Prepare a 1:1 dilution of the cell suspension in trypan blue (50 μL trypan blue + 50 μL cell suspension) in an Eppendorf tube.
Count cells that exclude trypan blue on both sides of a hemocytometer
Calculate the cell concentration in the cell suspension
Calculate and record the number of cells obtained per plate during this passage.

Calculate the number of population doublings that occurred during the last passage (include the indicated values in the associated worksheet) and adding that number to the previous APD:([(3.32(log(cells collected per plate)-log(cells plated per plate)) + previous APD])
Dilute cells to 4.0 x 104 cells/mL in growth medium in a 50 mL tube to the total volume that will be used for plating

Mix thoroughly by inverting 10 times and dispense the diluted cell suspension into each dish. Distribute cell suspension on the dish through a combination of gentle rocking and swirling of the dish for approximately 15 seconds
Place in a tissue culture incubator. Cells will be ready to split three days after plating
Place bottles of growth medium and DPBS in 5% CO2 incubator with lids partially unscrewed for 15 minutes to adjust pH before returning to 4°C for storage.
Preparing cells for cryopreservation
Prepare freezing medium.
50% FBS, 40% growth medium, 10% DMSO.
Filter through a 0.2 μm pore syringe filter into a 50 mL conical tube.
Determine the number of cells present and pellet cells at 1,000 x g for 4 minutes at room temperature in centrifuge with a swinging bucket rotor
Carefully aspirate the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet in freezing medium at a density of 1.25 x 106 cells/mL
Mix cell suspension by gently inverting 10 times and dispense 1 mL aliquots into cryovials with a P1000 pipette.
Place cryovials in a Mr. Frosty freezing container (filled to indicated line with isopropyl alcohol) and place in a -80 °C freezer overnight
